entries.meaning: A mixture of fine solid particles or liquid droplets suspended in a gaseous medium.
examples: Examples of common aerosols are mist, fog, and smoke.

entries.meaning: The payload (e.g. insecticide, paint, oil, cosmetics) and propellant contained by an aerosol can.
(physics) A colloidal system in which the dispersed phase is composed of either solid or liquid particles and in which the dispersal medium is some gas, usually air.

verbs.description: aerosol (third-person singular simple present aerosols, present participle aerosoling, simple past and past participle aerosoled)

examples: The door entrance and space going up the steps was aerosoled just before passengers started to enter. A second spray was given after they were aboard.
